headline: Luscious Spinach Artichoke Dip
description: This is a rich, delicious dip that can be served with tortilla chips or slices of toasted French bread. It can be easily substituted with fat-free ingredients for all of you health freaks out there!!! It's an absolute hit at all parties. Here are a few suggested garnishes: shredded Monterey jack cheese, chopped red bell peppers, parsley, sliced mushrooms, or bread crumbs.
name: Luscious Spinach Artichoke Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
0.5 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a small baking dish, mix together artichoke hearts, spinach, sour cream, mayonnaise, cream cheese, Romano cheese, and garlic. Cover dish.
Bake until heated through and bubbly, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Used Mexican 4 cheese (w/Monterey) and no cream cheese or Romano . Might try adding cream cheese next time. Pulsed artichoke, garlic, spinach.

Do yourself a favor and add a tablespoon (or more) of green Tabasco sauce, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, salt and pepper to taste. I used Parmesan cheese instead of Romano. Everyone loved it, even the picky eaters! Lots of compliments on the dip.
I thought it was pretty good. I love garlic so next time I would add some more.

I love any dip with artichokes in it! And I like it a bit chunky! So, my twist on this recipe is to add a bunch of roasted garlic instead of the powder. Not quite as easy (unless you can get roasted garlic in the olive bar....oh, will they ever bring back those pandemic casualties? The salad bar too?) How much to add is all up to you and how much you love garlic! Enjoy all variations!
Delicious. I had some leftover and made a frittata with it the next day. Just added eggs and a little more cheese then baked it. This was delicious also. I won’t throw away food!!

I made this recipe exactly and would not make again without some serious modifications, which looks like most that have given it a five star have already done. Needs way more flavour - either with more cream or shredded cheese, more garlic, spices, cheese on top...or all of the above!
I don’t usually measure any of the ingredients out, just dump in as I go. Added mozzarella cheese and it turns out great every time!

I had this with some lightly buttered toast. It was good, not great. needs less sour cream and more cream cheese. I'd also try adding less romano next time. on the other hand my dad loved this stuff and he ate a bunch of it. I was personally not that big of a fan but it's a solid recipe.

I thought the spinach flavor was way too strong...and that was with using an entire block of cream cheese. It would have been worse if I'd used the proportions in the original recipe. If I make this again, I will use 1/2 of a 10 ounce box of spinach and will add even more artichokes.

I've made it three times for parties I've been to. The first time I used fresh grated romano. The next two I just used a container of powdered parmesian. Great either way. I double the recipe and keep some at home :)
I added fresh parmesan cheese and fiesta cheese mix! Yummy
No one cared for it. Will have to substitute measurements of ingredients
I made this for a party and everyone loved it. I didn’t make any changes to the recipe. Definitely will make again.

I read a lot of reviews first. And if you like a creamier dip, use the entire block of cream cheese. I also added 2 tsp of garlic instead of 1/2, 1 tsp of garlic powder, and 1 tsp of onion powder. Was amazing with these modifications. Salt and pepper to taste.
Very yummy, followed recipe to the T.
Perfect addition to our New Years Eve Party. Tastes Great and a huge hit !!
After reading others’ modifications, I scrapped Romano and used monetary jack and Parmesan, used more spinach and garlic too and people tore it up!
K
I added some shredded Parmesan cheese to the mix and on top!

I prepared the dish according the to recipe. The flavors were decent, but a bit too runny for my taste. This is my first time making any type of artichoke dip, but I think it would be better if there was more cheese baked into it to give it more of a pull away thickness instead of the runny texture.

I added more cream cheese and more garlic plus garlic powder, and a splash of salt. Ended up using a three-cheese Italian blend, then topped with some Parmesan shreds. Baked uncovered the last five minutes. It was good!

Used 1 cup of sour cream, the whole block of cream cheese, half a cup of Romano, and half a cup of shredded Monterey Jack then after I mixed that w the garlic and spinach and mayo I sprinkled more Monterrey jack on top before putting it in the oven. It was a family favorite, I will for sure make it again!
I made this for a party; it must have been good because it was gone before I could make a plate. I only used half the can of artichokes drained and rinsed. I guess I’ll be making this again.
I took it to a super bowl party and everyone loved it!!!

First, I don’t think you should give it 5 stars and then show how to improve it. I was influenced by reviewers to change the original recipe by adding more cream cheese however this is a bad idea as it drowns out the flavor of the spinach and artichoke.
This dip is absolutely delicious. The only deviation I did was to add more cheese (pretty much doubled it) while adding some on top before baking. We made it three times in one week!

This is a party hit for sure! it's rich and creamy. I topped it off with the reccomend cheese as well as cheddar. I baked it with foil on until the last 7 minutes or so, which kept the cheese from hardening.
Amazingly delicious
It was so good so much better then store bought

As written, it came out very thick - not creamy at all. We joked it was a artichoke spinach casserole rather than dip. But taste was good. Just need to make again with an attempt to make it creamer by increasing one of the more liquidy ingredients. Also I used only romano cheese adding a layer of cheese on the top but that turned into a firm layer that wasn't easy to scoop either so note to self to not use that cheese on top again. Maybe try mozzarella as others have suggested.
It was a hit for our Christmas Eve festivities. I added crabmeat as well.

This is a great dish for parties or just for an everyday snack. I’ve made it for holiday parties and get togethers with friends and family. Everyone always loves it. I add a little more Romano cheese and fresh garli
not sure what everyone loved about it. Was not good for me
Absolutely loved it
Delicious! Added mozzarella cheese, salt, pepper, and almost the whole block of cream cheese.
I only gave it a three as written. I thought it was a little bland. I think it could be a five star with the addition of a little lemon juice and Monterrey jack cheese.
I made this for a parry and it was gone in no time.
I have made this many times and will make it tomorrow to take to an oyster roast as an appetizer. It always disappears quickly. It is delicious!
I followed the recipe but added the whole cream cheese block instead of just half.... I liked that better!! Otherwise it was all perfect!
yes. This was very good. The only change I made was I added a little salt and pepper and used a blend of shredded cheeses; Romano, parmesan, asiago and added extra cheese on top.
Good flavor and consistency, but I'd add more parmesan and more garlic.
Was so delicious and everyone went back for seconds!

Added some salt and pepper to taste, as well as some red pepper flakes and a dash of onion powder. Also substituted garlic cloves for garlic powder (and went a little heavy with it). Also substituted Greek yogurt for sour cream. Tastes great!
I wasn't a big fan of this recipe. It was rather bland.
This was a hit with all the family.
This was gone only minutes after I finished making it. I will have to make a double batch next time

I made a few revisions based on what I had in the pantry. I used fresh artichoke hearts from a dish I made the day before, canned spinach, and added a can of cream of mushroom soup in place of cream cheese. It's delicious!
We can’t stop making this one!
It’s always a hit! I add salt,pepper and parmesan cheese and sometimes a tad bit of cayenne pepper for a kick.
Easy to make and absolutely delicious. I used fresh Parmesan cheese instead of Romano because that is what I had in the fridge and sprinkled bread crumbs on top. Amazing.
It was a hit! Used parmesan and jalapeño cheddar cause that’s what I had.
This recipe is good I tweaked it. I added cream cheese and mozzarella cheese instead. I used the whole package of spinach also. Turned out great!
It was amazing was gone before the Christmas party had even fully started
I added lemon juice and it was delish!!!
ALWAYS a huge hit at parties and gone within the first hour. Thanks!!!

I really liked this, but after reading some of the reviews also made some modifications. The spinach and artichoke to white sauce ingredients didn't seem right, so I also doubled the creme cheese, mayo, and sour cream.. It also seemed too stiff, so added some milk to make it creamier. Lastly, I also doubled up on the cheese and garlic. It was really good and my guests loved it!

This is such a good recipe to start from when making spinach dip. Every time I’m I go to a restaurant, I love ordering it and wanted to make some of my own. I followed most of the directions except I added more Romano cheese to it (half the block) and sprinkled mozarella cheese on top. I am a cheese fan as you can tell...lol Anyway, my guests loved this recipe and I’m adding it to my side dishes.
With a bag of fresh spinach not frozen, a little more garlic and a dab of Baby Rays Honey Hot Sauce. Oh, 1/2 the amount mayo and sour cream and replaced other 1/2 with Greek Yogurt. Soooo delicious!!
My husband loved this dip! I added a bit more parm than it called for and we all loved the results!

I diced up the red bell pepper in a food processor and a added it to the mixture rather than a garnish. Next time I will add more cream cheese and sour cream. It tasted great. Was a hit at the party. I prefer it creamier.
Made this dip Saturday for friends and it turned out great. I served it with homemade rosemary bread and it was a hit!
It was soooooo dry. I'm not sure if it was my fault, thus the neutral rating. I will try a different recipe next time. Oh, my friends said it was good, but they had been drinking.

We really enjoyed this one. I used whatever I had in the fridge in place of a few things, but turned out well. I think maybe a little less mayonnaise would be the only thing I'd change. 

Variations:
1/2 lb (before cooked) steamed spinach in place of frozen
1/4 cup shreaded Italian cheese blend instead of Romano
1/8-1/4 cup shreaded mozzarella sprinkled on top

Round tortilla chips for dipping
I doubled the cream cheese and it ended up being way too rich. Still not too bad though.
Went over very well. Will make this again.

Perfect dip for a medium sized group (8-10 people). I doubled the cream cheese and garlic to balance a bit of added spinach. I also added 4oz of Monterey Jack cheese in the mix with another 4oz on top. Topped with fresh jalapenos and after cooking time, removed aluminum foil cover and cranked the oven on to low broil for 5 minutes to allow the cheese and jalapenos to brown slightly.
Delicious! I've made it twice this month!

My family loved this! I used a whole container of sour cream and Parmesan cheese, two jars of artichokes, the whole spinach, and the entire brick of cream cheese. I cooked it on low in a slow cooker for about four hours because we were away and I wanted it ready when we got back. So easy!
I used fresh spinach and more garlic, but it was still a huge hit for New Year's. I will definitely make it again.

I made this for my New Year's eve party. I did follow suggestions from other reviewers however. I added an additional 4 oz. of cream cheese, a teaspoon of lemon juice and a teaspoon of garlic powder. It came out really good but I will double all the cheeses next time. Thank you for sharing this recipe!

Fantastic! Baked it in my smaller round Pampered Chef pan and it stayed toasty warm just long enough for us to gobble it up New Year's Eve with blue nacho chips and thinly sliced baguette. Thanks for the great recipe!
We made this dip twice in one week. It was such a hit both times. This is my go to dip recipe!
My family loved it!
Super easy to make. I used a clove of garlic and that seemed to be a bit much.
Very good dip! The bowl was scraped clean, not even a drop left.
This was so good! Super quick and easy. Didn't have grated Romano, so I substituted 1/4 c of parmesan and added 1/4 c of shredded Colby Jack. Turned out great...Thank you!
Best artichoke dip I have ever made. good.
Made it for a work party and got lots of compliments. Used a full block of cream cheese and squeezed a splash of lemon, otherwise followed the rest of the directions and turned out nice and creamy.
This tasted ok, but I thought it was a little bland.
Best dip ever!! It was gone in 5 mins

This was a huge hit!!! Here are my changes (everything else the same):
Used an entire 10-oz. bag of spinach (MAKE SURE YOU SQUEEZE TO DRAIN FIRST!!!)
SQUEEZE TO DRAIN ARTICHOKES, TOO, after rinsing thoroughly!
Used an 8 oz. tub of sour cream
Used an 8 oz. packet of cream cheese
Two heaping tablespoons of olive-oil based mayo
3 Cloves of Garlic
1/2 Cup grated Romano Cheese
Generous salt and pepper (I know, the cheese is salty, but you'd be surprised how much more salt it needs)
Sprinkled about 1/2 cup mozzarella on top
Baked for 30 minutes on convection, 375 degrees
IT WAS PERFECT!
Omg!!! The best recipe ever. Restaurant quality for sure and so easy. My only change was adding mozzarella cheese to the top. Yum.
I look for excuses to throw parties for the sole purpose of making this dish.
I made this recipe for a party I was having at my house and it was a hit! Everyone loved it. I will make this recipe again but next time I will add pepper jack cheese. Yummm

This recipe is always requested when I go to family events. I typically make it as written, but I have changed up the amounts of cream cheese, sour cream, and mayo depending what I have on hand. All of the combinations turn out great! I also add a ton of extra mozzarella cheese on top for super stringy-ness.
Great recipe and perfect portion! I added more minced garlic and used fresh spinach.

This was devoured and well complemented. I will make again, only this time I will double the amount of spinach.
Cheers

Best spinach artichoke dip ever!!! Better than the restaurant we would order from! I had 3 pre cooked fresh artichokes no one wanted to eat. I looked for a recipe. Had a bit of fresh steamed left over spinach. Added a bit more frozen I had in the freezer. Chopped the artichoke hearts and seasoned with olive oil, cider vinegar, salt and pepper. Seasoned the spinach a little w s/p. Has 1/3 cup left over freshly grated Gruyere cheese. It gave it a special touch. Added all other ingredients from recipe. Oven. Delicious!!!! Thank you!

My family loved it. It was AMAZING! Nobody could get enough of it. I didn't put in any mayo, but put in a little extra cream cheese and sour cream. I used shredded cheddar and Monterey Jack instead of Romano (couldn't find any in this small town). This recipe made lots, and I am DEFINITELY making this again!

Wow. I am rarely moved to submit reviews but this was such a hit I had no choice. AMAZING. I microwaved the mix until it was melted and then transferred to a small crock pot. SO DELICIOUS!!!! Will absolutely make this again.
This dip has a good texture and was popular at the party to which I took it. I did double the amount of spinach (I like spinach, and the dip looked like it could use a little extra).

added: 
1/2 can water chestnuts 
1/4 t salt 1/4 t pepper
1/2 t lemon juice
1/2 c monteray jack
no romano
double the garlic
chop spinach & artichokes in food processor

We ate it all, (on baguette) and it wasn't bad; my husband gives it 4 stars, but I would have liked it better with a layer of cheese melted on top, a longer baking time (I actually baked it a little longer than suggested), and removing the foil cover toward the end so it browns a little. Also, it tasted mostly of artichoke hearts and sour cream. I did add 1\2 teaspoon of salt and sprinkled some pepper, which it needed. I want to find a similar recipe but with a cheese layer on top, more spices, and I'll use the smallest jar of artichoke hearts so maybe the flavor won't be quite so dominant.
I thought that this was very good. Several compliments and my wife was happy to be eating artichokes (healthy), although covered in cheese.
Made as written. Was a hit!

I truly LOVED this dip. I have to make a double batch to keep up with the demand. However, I do use a mixture of Romano and Parmesan for the cheese. And for a double batch, only one and a half cans of artichoke hearts.
Yummy! Used the whole block of cream cheese as others recommended and an entire container of spinach. Creamy goodness!
I have tried several spinach and artichoke dip recipes and this is by far the best!

Luscious indeed! As suggested here,I did use the whole 8 oz. package of cream cheese, and subbed broccoli for the spinach as that's what I had on hand. Topped with a little mozzarella cheese and chopped red peppers and fresh parsley for that holiday look. Baked covered until the last five minutes, and it took a little longer to cook than the recipe indicated. Served with scooping style tortilla chips.
